title: Crossing Snow Bridges Safely
brief: How to safely cross natural snow bridges over crevasses or obstacles.
steps: Step 1: Always approach and cross snow bridges at right angles to the obstacle they span.
Step 2: Use a pole or ice axe to probe ahead and find the strongest part of the bridge.
Step 3: Distribute your weight by crawling across or wearing snowshoes/skis.
Step 4: Test each section before committing your full weight to it.
Step 5: Move deliberately - avoid sudden movements that could collapse the bridge.
warnings: Snow bridges can collapse suddenly under concentrated weight.
Falling through a snow bridge over a crevasse can be fatal.
Never trust the appearance of snow bridges - always test strength first.
